definition: variant of 黃檗|黄檗[huang2 bo4]
surname Huang or Hwang
yellow/pornographic/to fall through
(used for transcribing names)
surname Bai/Taiwan pr. [Bo2]
variant of 柏[bai3]
cedar/cypress/Taiwan pr. [bo2]
variant of 檗[bo4]

sentences.english: Most components of CP-RG could be found in the HP which could be found in two sigle herbs.
sentences.chinese: 黄柏的组分和甘草的组分在药对中基本都能找到。

sentences.english: In the case of Huangbaiyu, a lack of understanding of local needs presented problems.
sentences.chinese: 在黄柏裕的案例中，对当地需求缺乏了解造成了问题。

sentences.english: Huangbaiyu shows that local community participation is crucial.
sentences.chinese: 黄柏峪的经验显示，地方群众的参与是关键。

sentences.english: This thesis elaborates the studies on the chemical constituents from the leaves of Phellodendron chinense var.
sentences.chinese: 本论文详细论述了秃叶黄柏叶子化学成分的研究。

sentences.english: Result Two distinguishable TLC fingerprint chromatograms of Phellodendron chinensis Schneid.
sentences.chinese: 结果关黄柏及川黄柏薄层色谱指纹图谱存在明显差异。

sentences.english: Result Two distinguishable TLC fingerprint chromatograms of Phellodendron chinensis Schneid.
sentences.chinese: 结果关黄柏及川黄柏薄层色谱指纹图谱存在明显差异。

definition: Ningpo figwort (Scrophularia ningpoensis)/root of Ningpo figwort (used in TCM)
liquorice (Sophora flavescens), with roots used in TCM
root bark of the peony tree (used in TCM)
Chinese thorowax (Bupleurum chinense)/root of Chinese thorowax (used in TCM)
common water plantain (Alisma plantago-aquatica)/water plantain rhizome (used in TCM)
Manchurian wild ginger (family Asarum)
bamboo shavings (Bambusa tuldoides) used in Chinese medicine
Anemarrhena asphodeloides/rhyzome of Anemarrhena (used in TCM)
red nut sedge (Cyperus rotundus)
Notopterygium root (root of Notopterygium incisum)
the root bark of the peony tree
dried fruit of immature citron or trifoliate orange (used in TCM)
Achyranthes bidentata (root used in Chinese medicine)
blackberry lily (Belamcanda chinensis)/leopard lily
Chinese goldthread (Coptis chinensis), rhizome used in medicine
black atractylodes rhizome (dried rhizome of any of several atractylodes species) (TCM)
